title: How Many Calories in Bourbon?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in bourbon per standard shot, including full nutrition breakdown, basis per serving, and tips for variations.
assumptions: Standard 80-proof (40% ABV) bourbon, 1.5 fl oz (44 ml) serving, straight (no mixers or ice dilution).
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, proof, serving size, and any additions; alcohol content affects calories. Consult labels or apps for specifics.

quick_answer.text: One standard 1.5 oz shot of 80-proof bourbon contains about 97 calories, all from alcohol.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Mix with 4 oz diet soda (zero-calorie mixer)
Mix with 4 oz regular cola (adds sugar)

faqs.q: How many calories in one shot of bourbon?
faqs.a: Approximately 97 calories for a 1.5 oz serving of 80-proof bourbon.

faqs.q: Does bourbon have carbs or sugar?
faqs.a: Straight bourbon has 0 g carbs and 0 g sugars; calories come solely from alcohol.

faqs.q: How does proof affect calories in bourbon?
faqs.a: Higher proof means more calories—e.g., 100-proof adds about 24 kcal per shot vs. 80-proof.

faqs.q: Calories in bourbon vs. other whiskeys?
faqs.a: Similar for most whiskeys at 80-proof; flavored or sweetened varieties may add 10–50 kcal.
Yes, at 97 kcal per shot, it's comparable to vodka or gin but lower than sugary cocktails.
